Poros Island is in the Saronic Gulf, which, recent studies show, is full of plastic.
It washes up on beaches in a country that lives off tourism.
Endangered sea turtles choke on it.
George Sarelakos, the diver, sees fish eat it.
You know, when we dive, we see parts - plastic bags almost turn into microplastics floating around and fishes eating this microplastic.

And now to Virginia, where big elections are just around the corner.

Every seat in the statehouse is up for grabs in next month's election, and there will be a lot of new names on the ballot, including two young men running to be the first black Republicans elected to the legislature in almost 20 years.
Ben Paviour from member station VPM in Richmond says they're attempting to carve out a place in a party dominated by President Trump.
